name: Classic Brainstorming
description: Free-form idea generation with no criticism allowed
when_to_use: Starting a new topic or exploring possibilities

name: Brainwriting 6-3-5
description: 6 people write 3 ideas in 5 minutes then pass to next person
when_to_use: When group dynamics hinder verbal brainstorming

name: SCAMPER
description: Substitute Combine Adapt Modify Put-to-other-use Eliminate Reverse
when_to_use: Improving existing products or features

name: Mind Mapping
description: Visual diagram branching from a central concept
when_to_use: Exploring relationships between ideas

name: Reverse Brainstorming
description: Generate ways to cause the problem then reverse them
when_to_use: When stuck on solving a problem directly

name: Random Word Stimulus
description: Use a random word to trigger unexpected connections
when_to_use: When ideas have dried up or thinking is too narrow

name: Worst Possible Idea
description: Generate the worst ideas then flip them into good ones
when_to_use: Breaking creative blocks and reducing fear of judgment

name: TRIZ
description: Theory of Inventive Problem Solving with 40 principles
when_to_use: Solving technical contradictions in design

name: Analogical Thinking
description: Draw parallels from other industries or nature
when_to_use: Finding innovative solutions from different domains

name: What If Scenarios
description: Explore hypothetical scenarios to uncover opportunities
when_to_use: Stress-testing ideas or exploring edge cases

name: Crazy Eights
description: Sketch 8 ideas in 8 minutes on a folded paper
when_to_use: Rapid visual ideation for UI/UX design

name: Round Robin
description: Each person adds one idea in turn around the group
when_to_use: Ensuring equal participation in idea generation

name: Brain Netting
description: Online collaborative brainstorming using shared documents
when_to_use: Remote teams or asynchronous ideation

name: Starbursting
description: Generate questions (Who What Where When Why How) about an idea
when_to_use: Exploring all dimensions of a concept before deciding

name: Role Storming
description: Brainstorm from the perspective of different personas
when_to_use: Breaking personal biases and exploring diverse viewpoints

name: Forced Connections
description: Combine two unrelated concepts to spark new ideas
when_to_use: When conventional thinking yields no new ideas

name: Attribute Listing
description: List all attributes of a product then modify each one
when_to_use: Systematic improvement of existing features

name: Provocation (PO)
description: Make deliberately provocative statements to disrupt thinking
when_to_use: When thinking is stuck in established patterns

name: Rapid Ideation Sprint
description: Time-boxed burst of ideas with quantity over quality
when_to_use: Generating maximum volume of ideas quickly

name: Story Cubes
description: Use random story elements to trigger narrative-based ideas
when_to_use: Creating user stories or marketing narratives

name: Six Thinking Hats
description: Examine topic from 6 perspectives (facts emotions risks benefits creative process)
when_to_use: Evaluating complex decisions with multiple viewpoints

name: SWOT Analysis
description: Map Strengths Weaknesses Opportunities Threats
when_to_use: Strategic assessment of project or feature

name: Five Whys
description: Ask why 5 times to find root cause
when_to_use: Diagnosing root causes of problems

name: Fishbone (Ishikawa)
description: Diagram showing causes categorized by type leading to an effect
when_to_use: Analyzing complex problems with multiple contributing factors

name: PESTEL Analysis
description: Analyze Political Economic Social Technological Environmental Legal factors
when_to_use: Understanding external macro-environment impact

name: Value Proposition Canvas
description: Map customer jobs pains gains against product features
when_to_use: Ensuring product-market fit

name: Business Model Canvas
description: 9-block canvas covering key business model components
when_to_use: Defining or refining the business model

name: Lean Canvas
description: Simplified business model canvas focused on lean startup
when_to_use: Quick business model validation for startups

name: Jobs-To-Be-Done (JTBD)
description: Identify functional emotional social jobs customers hire products for
when_to_use: Understanding true customer motivations

name: Kano Model
description: Categorize features as Must-be Performance Delighter
when_to_use: Prioritizing features by customer satisfaction impact

name: MoSCoW Prioritization
description: Categorize as Must-have Should-have Could-have Wont-have
when_to_use: Quick prioritization of features or requirements

name: Empathy Map
description: Map what users Think Feel Say Do
when_to_use: Building deep understanding of user perspective

name: Assumption Mapping
description: List and rank assumptions by risk and uncertainty
when_to_use: Identifying which assumptions to test first

name: Decision Matrix
description: Score options against weighted criteria
when_to_use: Making objective decisions between alternatives

name: Cost-Benefit Analysis
description: Compare expected costs against expected benefits
when_to_use: Evaluating ROI of features or initiatives

name: Risk Assessment Matrix
description: Map risks by probability and impact
when_to_use: Identifying and prioritizing project risks

name: Trade-off Analysis
description: Explicitly compare what you gain vs lose with each option
when_to_use: Choosing between competing architectural or design options

name: Competitive Analysis Grid
description: Structured comparison of competitors on key dimensions
when_to_use: Understanding competitive landscape and positioning

name: Pre-Mortem
description: Imagine the project failed then work backwards to find causes
when_to_use: Proactively identifying risks before they happen

name: Opportunity Solution Tree
description: Tree mapping desired outcome to opportunities to solutions to experiments
when_to_use: Connecting customer needs to actionable experiments

name: Customer Journey Map
description: Visual timeline of customer touchpoints emotions and pain points
when_to_use: Understanding end-to-end user experience

name: Service Blueprint
description: Detailed map of service delivery including frontstage and backstage
when_to_use: Designing complex service interactions

name: User Story Mapping
description: 2D map with user activities across top and priority depth below
when_to_use: Planning releases and understanding user workflow

name: Wardley Map
description: Value chain positioned on evolution axis from genesis to commodity
when_to_use: Strategic technology and component decisions

name: Impact Map
description: Goal → Actors → Impacts → Deliverables tree
when_to_use: Connecting business goals to product features

name: C4 Model Diagram
description: 4-level architecture diagram (Context Container Component Code)
when_to_use: Documenting and communicating software architecture

name: Event Storming
description: Collaborative modeling using domain events on sticky notes
when_to_use: Discovering domain model and bounded contexts

name: Affinity Diagram
description: Group related ideas into clusters after brainstorming
when_to_use: Organizing large numbers of ideas into themes

name: Concept Map
description: Diagram showing relationships between concepts with labeled links
when_to_use: Understanding and communicating complex knowledge domains

name: Flowchart / Process Map
description: Step-by-step diagram of a process with decision points
when_to_use: Documenting workflows and identifying bottlenecks

name: Storyboarding
description: Sequential visual frames showing user interaction scenarios
when_to_use: Communicating user experience and feature flows

name: Architecture Decision Record
description: Structured document recording architectural decisions and rationale
when_to_use: Documenting and justifying technical choices

name: Stakeholder Map
description: Visual map of stakeholders by influence and interest
when_to_use: Identifying key people to engage at each phase

name: Data Flow Diagram
description: Diagram showing how data moves through the system
when_to_use: Understanding data processing and storage needs

name: Personas Canvas
description: Detailed user persona with demographics behaviors goals frustrations
when_to_use: Creating shared understanding of target users

name: Dot Voting
description: Each person gets dots to vote on favorite ideas
when_to_use: Quick democratic prioritization of ideas

name: Impact/Effort Matrix
description: Plot ideas on 2x2 grid of impact vs effort
when_to_use: Identifying quick wins and strategic projects

name: 100 Dollar Test
description: Distribute imaginary $100 across options to show preference
when_to_use: Forcing trade-off decisions in prioritization

name: NUF Test
description: Score ideas on New Useful Feasible criteria
when_to_use: Quick filtering of ideas for viability

name: Forced Ranking
description: Rank all options from best to worst with no ties allowed
when_to_use: Making definitive choices between similar options

name: Pugh Matrix
description: Compare design alternatives against a baseline on multiple criteria
when_to_use: Systematic evaluation of design concepts

name: Sean Ellis Test
description: Ask users how disappointed they would be without the product
when_to_use: Measuring product-market fit

name: ICE Scoring
description: Score ideas on Impact Confidence Ease
when_to_use: Prioritizing features or experiments

name: RICE Scoring
description: Score ideas on Reach Impact Confidence Effort
when_to_use: Data-driven prioritization of product features

name: Buy-a-Feature
description: Give participants budget to buy features they want most
when_to_use: Collaborative feature prioritization with stakeholders

name: Weighted Decision Matrix
description: Score options against criteria with different weights per criterion
when_to_use: Complex decisions with multiple important criteria

name: Nominal Group Technique
description: Silent idea generation then round-robin sharing and voting
when_to_use: Structured group decision-making reducing bias

name: Delphi Method
description: Multiple rounds of anonymous expert input with feedback
when_to_use: Complex decisions requiring expert consensus

name: Speed Boat
description: Identify anchors (problems) slowing down the project boat
when_to_use: Retrospective identification of blockers and issues

name: Fist of Five
description: Quick consensus check with 1-5 finger vote
when_to_use: Rapid team alignment on decisions

name: Technical Spike Planning
description: Structured exploration of unknown technical territory with time-box
when_to_use: Reducing technical uncertainty before committing to implementation

name: Feature Flag Strategy
description: Plan which features to gate behind flags for progressive rollout
when_to_use: Managing risk during deployment of new features

name: Launch Readiness Storm
description: Brainstorm all launch requirements across marketing ops support legal
when_to_use: Ensuring nothing is missed before going live

name: Growth Experiment Canvas
description: Structured canvas for designing growth experiments with hypothesis and metrics
when_to_use: Planning data-driven growth initiatives

name: Retention Cohort Brainstorm
description: Analyze retention by cohort and brainstorm improvements for each stage
when_to_use: Improving user retention at specific lifecycle points
